author: lightclient
content:
I have a telegram bot that sends a notification using the prometheus alert manager -- this is an example `rules.yml` to give prometheus: 

```
groups:
- name: AllInstances
  rules:
  - alert: InstanceDown
    expr: up == 0
    for: 1m
    annotations:
      title: 'Instance {{ $labels.instance }} down'
      description: '{{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} has been down for more than 1 minute.'
    labels:
      severity: 'critical'
  - alert: LostConnectivity
    expr: libp2p_peer_connected_peers_total < 5
    for: 30s
    annotations:
      title: 'Instance {{ $labels.instance }} has less than 5 peers'
      description: '{{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} has had less than 5 peers for more than 30 seconds.'
    labels:
      severity: 'critical'
```

alertmanager.yml: 
```
global:
  resolve_timeout: 5m

route:
  receiver: 'telegram'
  group_by: ['alertname']
  group_wait: 10s
  group_interval: 10s
  repeat_interval: 1h

receivers:
- name: 'telegram'
  webhook_configs:
  - url: 'http://127.0.0.1:9876/alert'

inhibit_rules:
  - source_match:
      severity: 'critical'
    target_match:
      severity: 'warning'
    equal: ['alertname', 'dev', 'instance']
```
then using sachet to forward the message to telegram (it support many different chat apps): https://github.com/messagebird/sacheta
